projects.title: Multi-Tenant SaaS Platform with Microservices
projects.description: Build a complete multi-tenant SaaS platform with microservices architecture, tenant isolation, and platform-level features
projects.shortDescription: Production-ready multi-tenant SaaS with microservices architecture
projects.fullDescription: Design and implement a multi-tenant SaaS application platform from scratch, featuring microservices architecture, tenant-specific data isolation, user management, billing integration, and admin dashboards. This project demonstrates senior-level full-stack architecture skills including distributed systems, scalability patterns, and platform engineering. Showcases end-to-end ownership from database design to deployment infrastructure.

implementationSteps.title: Architecture Design & Service Decomposition
implementationSteps.description: Design the system architecture with core services: Auth Service (tenant-aware authentication), User Service (user management), Billing Service (subscription handling), Notification Service (email/SMS), and Admin Service (platform management). Define API contracts, data models, and inter-service communication patterns (REST + event-driven). Choose multi-tenant isolation strategy: shared database with tenant_id, database-per-tenant, or hybrid approach.

implementationSteps.title: Build Core Microservices with Node.js/NestJS
implementationSteps.description: Implement each microservice as an independent application with its own database. Use NestJS or Express with TypeScript for backend services. Implement tenant context propagation across service boundaries using request headers/middleware. Set up message queue (RabbitMQ or Kafka) for async communication between services. Implement API Gateway using Kong or Express Gateway for routing and tenant resolution.

implementationSteps.title: Multi-Tenant Frontend with Next.js
implementationSteps.description: Build a multi-tenant frontend using Next.js with subdomain or path-based tenant routing (e.g., tenant1.app.com or app.com/tenant1). Implement tenant-aware authentication flow with JWT tokens containing tenant context. Create shared UI component library with tenant-specific theming/branding. Build admin dashboard for platform management, tenant provisioning, and analytics.

implementationSteps.title: Database Design & Data Isolation
implementationSteps.description: Implement tenant data isolation using PostgreSQL with row-level security (RLS) or separate schemas per tenant. Design database schema for: users, tenants, subscriptions, audit logs. Implement database migrations using TypeORM or Prisma. Add Redis for caching tenant configurations and session management. Ensure all queries include tenant context to prevent data leakage.

implementationSteps.title: Platform Features & Observability
implementationSteps.description: Implement platform-level features: tenant onboarding flow, subscription management, usage tracking, rate limiting per tenant. Add observability: structured logging (Winston/Pino), distributed tracing (Jaeger), metrics (Prometheus), and dashboards (Grafana). Implement health checks and circuit breakers using libraries like Opossum.

implementationSteps.title: Kubernetes Deployment & CI/CD
implementationSteps.description: Containerize all services using Docker with multi-stage builds. Create Kubernetes manifests: Deployments, Services, Ingress, ConfigMaps, Secrets. Set up Helm charts for easier deployment management. Implement CI/CD pipeline using GitHub Actions or GitLab CI: automated testing, Docker builds, and deployment to K8s cluster. Add horizontal pod autoscaling based on CPU/memory metrics. Deploy to cloud provider (AWS EKS, GCP GKE, or DigitalOcean Kubernetes).

projects.title: Real-Time Collaborative Document Editor
projects.description: Build a real-time collaborative document editor with operational transformation, WebSockets, presence awareness, and conflict resolution
projects.shortDescription: Real-time collaborative editor with conflict resolution and presence
projects.fullDescription: Create a production-grade real-time collaborative document editing platform similar to Google Docs or Notion. Implement operational transformation (OT) or CRDTs for conflict-free concurrent editing, WebSocket-based real-time communication, user presence tracking, document versioning, and rich text editing capabilities. This project demonstrates advanced full-stack skills including real-time systems, distributed data consistency, and complex state management.

implementationSteps.title: Backend Architecture with WebSockets
implementationSteps.description: Set up a Node.js backend with Socket.IO or native WebSockets for real-time communication. Design document state management system using Redis for session storage and PostgreSQL for persistence. Implement room-based architecture where each document has its own WebSocket room. Create APIs for document CRUD operations, user authentication (JWT), and permissions management (owner, editor, viewer roles).

implementationSteps.title: Operational Transformation Engine
implementationSteps.description: Implement conflict resolution using Operational Transformation (OT) with libraries like ShareDB or build custom OT using the Transform Property approach. Handle concurrent edits: when multiple users type simultaneously, transform operations to maintain consistency. Store operation history for undo/redo functionality and version control. Implement cursor position transformation so user cursors remain accurate after remote edits.

implementationSteps.title: Rich Text Editor Frontend
implementationSteps.description: Build the editor interface using Slate.js or TipTap for rich text editing capabilities. Implement formatting: bold, italic, headings, lists, code blocks, links, images. Create a collaborative layer that broadcasts local changes via WebSocket and applies remote changes to the editor. Handle edge cases: rapid typing, network latency, reconnection scenarios. Add autosave functionality with debouncing.

implementationSteps.title: Presence & Collaborative Features
implementationSteps.description: Implement real-time user presence: show active users with avatars and colored badges. Build collaborative cursors showing where each user is typing in real-time. Add user awareness indicators: who's viewing, who's editing, idle detection. Implement comment threads and inline discussions anchored to document positions. Create notification system for mentions and document changes.

implementationSteps.title: Document Versioning & History
implementationSteps.description: Build version control system: save snapshots of document state at regular intervals or significant edits. Create history viewer UI showing timeline of changes with author information and timestamps. Implement restore-to-version functionality allowing users to revert to previous states. Add diffing capability to compare versions and highlight changes. Store version metadata efficiently to avoid database bloat.

implementationSteps.title: Performance Optimization & Deployment
implementationSteps.description: Optimize for large documents: implement virtual scrolling, lazy loading of content blocks. Add compression for WebSocket messages to reduce bandwidth. Implement conflict-free replicated data types (CRDTs) as alternative to OT for better performance. Set up horizontal scaling for WebSocket servers using Redis pub/sub for cross-server communication. Deploy backend to AWS/GCP with load balancing, frontend to Vercel/Netlify. Add monitoring for WebSocket connections, latency metrics, and collaboration conflicts.

projects.title: Internal Developer Platform with Self-Service Tools
projects.description: Build an internal developer platform enabling self-service environment provisioning, deployment pipelines, and infrastructure management
projects.shortDescription: Developer platform with GitOps, IaC, and self-service capabilities
projects.fullDescription: Design and implement an internal developer platform (IDP) that empowers engineering teams with self-service infrastructure provisioning, CI/CD pipeline management, environment orchestration, and observability dashboards. This project demonstrates platform engineering expertise including infrastructure as code, GitOps workflows, developer experience optimization, and building tools that scale engineering productivity. Showcases technical leadership through creating force-multiplier platforms.

implementationSteps.title: Platform Architecture & Design
implementationSteps.description: Design platform architecture with core components: Service Catalog (templates for services, databases, queues), Environment Manager (dev, staging, prod provisioning), Pipeline Orchestrator (CI/CD workflows), Observability Hub (metrics, logs, traces aggregation). Define platform API contracts and self-service workflows. Choose IaC tool (Terraform or Pulumi) and GitOps approach. Design multi-tenancy: how teams isolate resources, namespaces, quotas.

implementationSteps.title: Infrastructure as Code Foundation
implementationSteps.description: Build reusable Terraform/Pulumi modules for common infrastructure patterns: Kubernetes clusters, databases (RDS, CloudSQL), message queues (SQS, Pub/Sub), caching (Redis), object storage (S3). Create platform modules that combine primitives: full-stack-service module provisions K8s namespace, database, Redis, ingress, monitoring. Implement state management with remote backends (Terraform Cloud, S3). Add policy as code using Sentinel or OPA for security/compliance validation.

implementationSteps.title: Self-Service Portal Frontend
implementationSteps.description: Build admin/developer portal using Next.js with authentication (OAuth with Google/GitHub). Create service catalog UI: browse templates, configure parameters, preview infrastructure changes. Build environment provisioning wizard: multi-step form collecting service name, resource requirements, database type, scaling config. Display infrastructure status dashboard showing all team resources, costs, health. Add request/approval workflow for production resources. Implement search and filtering for large catalogs.

implementationSteps.title: GitOps & Pipeline Automation
implementationSteps.description: Set up GitOps using ArgoCD or Flux: all infrastructure changes go through Git pull requests. Build CI/CD pipeline templates using GitHub Actions or GitLab CI: standard pipelines for Node.js, Python, Go services. Create pipeline orchestration API: trigger builds, query status, rollback deployments. Implement progressive delivery: canary deployments, blue-green, feature flags integration. Add automated testing gates: security scanning (Snyk, Trivy), performance tests, integration tests.

implementationSteps.title: Observability & Developer Tools
implementationSteps.description: Integrate observability stack: Prometheus for metrics, Loki for logs, Tempo for traces, Grafana for dashboards. Build unified observability UI showing service health, SLOs, error budgets. Create developer CLI tool (using Commander.js or Cobra) for platform operations: `platform deploy`, `platform logs`, `platform scale`. Implement cost tracking showing per-team infrastructure spending. Add developer documentation portal (Docusaurus) with runbooks, tutorials, API references.

implementationSteps.title: Platform APIs & Production Deployment
implementationSteps.description: Build platform backend APIs using NestJS or FastAPI: service provisioning, environment management, metrics aggregation. Implement webhook handlers for Git events, CI/CD notifications, alerting. Add audit logging for all platform operations: who provisioned what, configuration changes, access patterns. Deploy platform itself using same IaC patterns (dogfooding). Set up platform monitoring and SLOs: provisioning time, deployment success rate, MTTR. Create onboarding documentation and conduct platform demos to engineering teams.
